image.altText: A silhouette of domestic violence victim Jane

props.synopsis: A Sydney woman wins a lengthy court battle to clear her name after being charged with assaulting her husband, who she claims was abusing her.

title.children: Jane reported her husband for domestic violence, days later police charged her with assault

image.altText: Water over a road with cars stopped at either side.

props.synopsis: The State Emergency Service says it has carried out 26 rescues across Victoria as heavy rain prompts warnings of flash flooding. Areas around Bendigo have been hardest hit.

title.children: Dozens of rescues amid flash flooding in Victoria, more rain on the way

image.altText: A soccer player wearing yellow and green and pink shoes runs during a game

props.synopsis: Kerr ruptures an ACL while in a mid-season training camp with Chelsea and is unlikely to play at the Paris Olympics if the Matildas earn qualification.

title.children: Matildas captain Sam Kerr suffers 'devastating' ACL injury six months out from Olympics

image.altText: Golden Globes blog thumbnail

props.synopsis: The Golden Globes are underway in Beverly Hills, with the best in film and television to be crowned. Follow live.

title.children: Stars arrive on Golden Globes red carpet as Barbie, Oppenheimer lead nominees

image.altText: Images of a snake, lizards and a larger monitor lizard in separate containers

props.synopsis: NSW Police dismantled a criminal syndicate allegedly trying to export hundreds of native Australian lizards and reptiles to Hong Kong.

title.children: Police investigating criminal syndicate seize native lizards and snakes worth up to $1.2m

image.altText: A brown snake with its tongue out on a rock

props.synopsis: There is no shortage of snakes this summer, or ideas on how to avoid them — especially from so-called experts on social media — but those in the field say one simple action might be the most effective of all.

title.children: With summer comes snake season and all sorts of safety ideas, but one simple strategy tops the lot

image.altText: A korean soldier looks out from a concrete viewing post

props.synopsis: From a brutal axe murder to a defector making a desperate escape for freedom in a hail of bullets, these are just a few of the violent incidents that have occurred in the DMZ.

title.children: Axe murders and an assassin squad: Why this part of Korea is the 'scariest place on Earth'

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is set to open flat when trading begins, despite Wall Street ending on a positive note last week. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX to open flat as traders watch for interest rate hints

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX opens flat as US jobs data dashes hopes of early rate cuts
ASX set to open flat as hopes for early rate cuts dampened

image.altText: Ryan Gosling as Ken with bleached blonde hair and a denim shirt showcasing his abs

props.synopsis: Can anything spoil the Barbenheimer party? Will Succession sweep the TV awards? Here is the full list of nominees for today's Golden Globes.

title.children: Golden Globes 2024: See all the nominees ahead of this morning's ceremony

image.altText: Man in red and yellow dive rescuer gear points at a map

props.synopsis: The three adults and two guides have been stuck in the Križna Jama cave since Saturday when water levels rose inside, blocking the way out.

title.children: Five people trapped in Slovenian caves after heavy rainfall

image.altText: Oxygen masks dangle in front of several plane seats with the window missing from a plane.

props.synopsis: The aircraft lost a window and a piece of fuselage, forcing it to make an emergency landing in Portland, Oregon.

title.children: 'Very fortunate' no passengers seated near Boeing 737-9 blowout, says US Transportation Board

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: Kathy Claxton needs opioids like Sevredol

props.synopsis: Doctors hold growing concerns about a significant shortage of opioid pain medicines given to some of the sickest Australians.

title.children: 'Health crisis' looming as series of pain relief opioid medications discontinued

image.altText: An image of a man in his 30s sitting on a wooden deck, next to an image of man in his 60s in a workshop

props.synopsis: Amid the rubble of Ukrainian buildings destroyed by Russian attacks, Australian builders Manfred Hin and Hamish Stirling have put their lives on hold, picked up their tools and gotten to work.

title.children: Meet the Australian 'builders without borders' repairing war-torn homes and schools in Ukraine

image.altText: A pair of gloves holding a metal implement and a beached whale in the background.

props.synopsis: In his home workshop, Melbourne engineer Girius Antanaitis designed a way to help stranded whales who could not be saved. He wants to use his skills to make the world a better place, especially for wildlife.

title.children: Girius has built a giant needle. It's putting stranded whales out of their misery

image.altText: Rafael Nadal sitting appearing to be in pain with his hands on his hips.

props.synopsis: Rafael Nadal is out of the Australian Open and will return to Spain immediately to seek treatment for a muscle tear he sustained in his first tennis tournament back after nearly a year off with injury.

title.children: Rafael Nadal may have played in Australia for the final time, withdraws from AO

image.altText: Two cars covered in dust.

props.synopsis: The reshuffled Northern Territory government has refused to investigate health concerns about the remote manganese mine at the centre of former chief minister Natasha Fyles's resignation in December.

title.children: Fresh call for health tests on Groote Eylandt due to mine dust, following chief minister's resignation

image.altText: crowd of people at a rave

props.synopsis: Seven of the eight people believed to have overdosed at Hardmission Festival were placed into induced comas and required breathing tubes.

title.children: Eight people in a critical condition following suspected drug overdose at a Melbourne rave

image.altText: Southern elephant seal pup

props.synopsis: As scientists investigate a suspected case of avian influenza on the tip of the Antarctic Peninsula, a new study confirms the devastating impact of the highly contagious and deadly disease on elephant seal pups.

title.children: Scientists 'distressed' after bird flu kills thousands of seal pups as disease nears Antarctica

image.altText: Police and fire trucks.

props.synopsis: The 65-year-old woman died earlier this morning after suffering severe burns in a house fire at Bribbaree in southern New South Wales on Sunday.

title.children: Man charged with murder after woman dies from burns in NSW house fire

image.altText: An orange tarp is draped over a roof frame after the top was blown off.

props.synopsis: The Queensland government says it will take years to get homes repaired, after wild storms and flooding lashed the south-east over the Christmas holidays.

title.children: Storm-ravaged homes to take years to rebuild in Queensland after back-to-back natural disasters

image.altText: Children wearing hits smile excitedly beside a man with a bushy beard. Containers with bamboo sticks are in front of them

props.synopsis: From a DIY pizza garden to making the ultimate dinosaur paradise, check out these affordable, at-home activities to get the kids into the garden these school holidays.

title.children: Looking for some school holiday activities? We've handpicked a bunch for you

image.altText: Helicopter flies over snow on mountain

props.synopsis: The avalanche, at a height of around 2,200 metres, swept away the pair, who were wearing snowshoes to navigate the mountains.

title.children: Two hikers on outing with their dog killed by Italian Alps avalanche

image.altText: A tall tennis player stares down at the court in frustration as she gestures with her racquet and arms.

props.synopsis: Aryna Sabalenka's Australian Open title defence suffers a blow, as a poor performance and injury timeout in the Brisbane International final raise questions after her loss to Elena Rybakina.

title.children: 'Thank you for the three games!': Aryna Sabalenka laughs off Brisbane final thrashing by Elena Rybakina

image.altText: A smiling blonde woman, Alex, smiles, with beef cattle in the background on her lush paddock.

props.synopsis: A year on from flooding that devastated communities along the River Murray, farmers like Meiqing Lin and Alexandra Westlake are still feeling the impact.

title.children: 'I'm trying to push mothering ewes through': Flood plain farmers reflect on emotional and financial impact of floods

image.altText: Several people stand amongst piles of rubble.

props.synopsis: Three months on from the conflict, Western diplomats are trying to prevent the war from spreading, despite Israel continuing with its military campaign.

title.children: Conflict in Gaza intensifies as Western diplomats seek ways to prevent war from spreading in Middle East

image.altText: a young african man sitting behind weights at a gym

props.synopsis: A 19-year-old man whose body was found on a remote road near Alice Springs has been described as an "independent boy" and hard-working mechanic.

title.children: Body of 19yo man found in Alice Springs named as 'beloved son' Yoal Gatluak

image.altText: An older man standing in front of a long shop window.

props.synopsis: Hardware store owner Frank Penhalluriack faced massive fines, financial ruin and went to jail as he fought for what he believed in. He won, and has changed how we live, work and socialise.

title.children: Frank thought you should be able to do jobs around the house on weekends. It put him in jail

image.altText: A group of cyclists sitting on their bikes looking solemn, one cyclist comforts another with an arm around the other.

props.synopsis: Competitors at the three-day AusCycling Road National Championships in Ballarat have taken a moment of silence in honour of the renowned Olympian, who died on Saturday, December 30.

title.children: 'Amazing athlete': Cyclists pay touching tribute to beloved champion Melissa Hoskins
